conclusion: To determine concentration difference, analyze refraction using Snell's Law.
Snell's Law relates angles of incidence and refraction with refractive indices.
Incident angle θ is the same for both glasses; refraction angles are β1 for cup A and β2 for cup B; β1 > β2.
Refractive index of sucrose water increases with sucrose concentration.
Refraction angle β depends on refractive index n2; larger n2 leads to smaller β.
In cup A, β1 > β2 implies refractive index n2 in cup A is smaller than in cup B.
Smaller refractive index n2 in cup A corresponds to lower sucrose concentration.
The concentration of sucrose water in cup A is lower than in cup B.
